nodes.bodyText: All other test methods start with lower-case so we should follow the same rule.
Thank you! I was copy pasting in order to make no typos...
I am not sure if this is too much detail or not. I'll let @FroMage decide

Maybe we could go just with this explanation.
@DisabledOnNativeImage("Disabled in the native mode as there is no interaction with any endpoint")

@rsvoboda This is valid. I described the reason for the test as there is no issue ticket linkable.
I do not know how much detail to put in there...
@FroMage Is this too much information in the comment?
It's long and not super useful, but it doesn't hurt so whatever :)
This line confuses me: Thus this test is enabled in native mode. The test code runs the JVM and not native.
Ohh... my fault... it should be disabled instead of enabled...

This test ensures that there something done that this does not happen

This doesn't seem a valid sentence.

"This test ensures that the attribute persistent is not generated when using Jackson"
Better?
I will adapt the PR next week. At the moment I do not have access to a my workstation...
